description: VSFTPD 2.3.4 contains a malicious backdoor that grants remote root access.
OpenSSH version installed is vulnerable to remote code execution allowing attackers to execute arbitrary commands.
Apache server allows directory traversal enabling disclosure of system files.
FTP is transmitting credentials in plaintext which can be intercepted by network attackers.
SMB shares use weak passwords allowing brute-force access to sensitive shares.

column9: allowing man-in-the-middle attacks on SMB sessions.
